details.title: Smear signature morphology of surface targets with arbitrary motion in spotlight synthetic aperture radar imagery

authors.affiliation: Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Naval Postgraduate School, Monterey, California
authors.name: David Garren

details.abstract: This study develops a methodology for analytically predicting the detailed smear signature morphology of surface targets with arbitrary motion in spotlight synthetic aperture radar (SAR) imagery. The radar sensor is assumed to move with constant speed and heading on a level flight path with broadside imaging geometry. Cases of uniform target motion exhibit morphology of simply curved smear shapes, as has been reported previously. However, the present analysis shows that non-uniform target motion can cause complicated smear shapes in spotlight SAR imagery. Specifically, the method of stationary phase is applied to local subaperture SAR images to yield analytic non-parametric expressions for the morphology of smear signatures within spotlight SAR imagery for surface targets with arbitrary motion trajectories. This predictive capability offers the potential of extracting some characteristics of true target motion based upon the induced SAR smear signatures alone.

ieee.title: Theory of Two-Dimensional Signature Morphology for Arbitrarily Moving Surface Targets in Squinted Spotlight Synthetic Aperture Radar
ieee.displayText: David Alan Garren, "Theory of Two-Dimensional Signature Morphology for Arbitrarily Moving Surface Targets in Squinted Spotlight Synthetic Aperture Radar", Geoscience and Remote Sensing IEEE Transactions on, vol. 53, pp. 4997-5008, 2015, ISSN 0196-2892.

ieee.title: Signatures of surface targets with increasing speed in spotlight synthetic aperture radar
ieee.displayText: David Alan Garren, "Signatures of surface targets with increasing speed in spotlight synthetic aperture radar", Radar Conference (RadarCon) 2015 IEEE, pp. 1114-1118, 2015.

ieee.title: Signatures of braking surface targets in spotlight synthetic aperture radar
ieee.displayText: David Alan Garren, "Signatures of braking surface targets in spotlight synthetic aperture radar", Sensor Signal Processing for Defence (SSPD) 2014, pp. 1-5, 2014.

ieee.title: Moving target morphology in SAR images
ieee.displayText: Kaan Duman, Birsen Yazıcı, "Moving target morphology in SAR images", Radar Conference (RadarCon) 2015 IEEE, pp. 1595-1599, 2015.

ieee.title: Moving Target Artifacts in Bistatic Synthetic Aperture Radar Images
ieee.displayText: Kaan Duman, Birsen Yazıcı, "Moving Target Artifacts in Bistatic Synthetic Aperture Radar Images", Computational Imaging IEEE Transactions on, vol. 1, pp. 30-43, 2015, ISSN 2333-9403.

ieee.title: Signature Morphology Effects of Squint Angle for Arbitrarily Moving Surface Targets in Spotlight Synthetic Aperture Radar
ieee.displayText: David Alan Garren, "Signature Morphology Effects of Squint Angle for Arbitrarily Moving Surface Targets in Spotlight Synthetic Aperture Radar", Geoscience and Remote Sensing IEEE Transactions on, vol. 53, pp. 6241-6251, 2015, ISSN 0196-2892.

ieee.title: Moving target morphology in bistatic SAR imagery
ieee.displayText: Kaan Duman, Birsen Yazici, "Moving target morphology in bistatic SAR imagery", Radar Symposium (IRS) 2015 16th International, pp. 565-570, 2015.
